display_name: NSRR Subject ID
description: This subject identifier was created by the National Sleep Research Resource (NSRR) team to more easily match with file downloads. Use 'pptid' to link with Biologic Specimen and Data Repository Information Coordinating Center (BioLINCC) and cohort-specific data.

display_name: Body mass index (BMI) (Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1))
description: Body Mass Index (BMI) at Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1)

display_name: Height (Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1))
description: The SHHS Coordinating Center bottom and top coded this variable using a lower limit of 145 centimeters and an upper limit of 188 centimeters.

display_name: Hip Circumference (Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1))
description: Hip measurement in centimeters

display_name: Neck Circumference (Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1))
description: Neck circumference in centimeters

display_name: Waist Circumference (Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1))
description: Waist measurement in centimeters

display_name: Weight (Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1))
description: The SHHS Coordinating Center bottom and top coded this variable using a lower limit of 47 kilograms and an upper limit of 126 kilograms.

display_name: Weight at Blood Pressure (BP) measurement (Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1))
description: The SHHS Coordinating Center bottom and top coded this variable using a lower limit of 47 kilograms and an upper limit of 126 kilograms.

display_name: Education level of the participant
Age at Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1)
description: Age at time of study in years, based on start date of Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1) Polysomnography (PSG) recording.

display_name: Age at Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1)
description: Age at time of study in years, based on start date of Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1) Polysomnography (PSG) recording. Values equal to 90 indicate an age of 90 or greater.

display_name: Marital status of the participant
Ethnicity (Hispanic or Latino) of the participant
description: Note: This variable was derived from `race` and was not asked as a separate demographic question. At the time of SHHS Visit 1, race and ethnicity were collected together in a single question. This variable was derived later on when the datasets were prepared for deposition in Biologic Specimen and Data Repository Information Coordinating Center (BioLINCC).

display_name: Gender of the participant
description: Gender as reported by Parent Cohort

display_name: Race of the participant
description: Race is presented as three (3) categories based on [suggested Biologic Specimen and Data Repository Information Coordinating Center (BioLINCC) de-identification procedures](http://www.nhlbi.nih.gov/research/funding/human-subjects/set-preparation-guidelines).

display_name: Health Interview (Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1)): Aspirin in last 2 weeks
description: In last two weeks, did you take any aspirin or aspirin containing meds?

display_name: Health Interview (Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1)): cups of coffee on a regular day
description: How many cups of regular coffee do you drink on a regular day? (Number of cups of coffee, up to 2 digits)

display_name: Health Interview (Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1)): smoked cigarettes
description: Have you ever smoked cigarettes ('ever' = at least 20 packs in lifetime)?

display_name: Health Interview (Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1)): now smoke cigarettes
description: Do you now smoke cigarettes?

display_name: Smoking Status at Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1)
description: Current Smoking Status at the Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1) visit

display_name: Health Interview (Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1)): cups of soda (with caffeine) on a regular day
description: How many cups/glasses of cola/soda (with caffeine) do you drink on a regular day?  (Number of cups/glasses of soda, up to 2 digits)

display_name: Health Interview (Sleep Heart Health Study Visit One (SHHS1)): cups of tea on a regular day
description: How many cups of tea (with caffeine) do you drink on a regular day? (Number of cups of tea, up to 2 digits)
